thread.section_title: Park Lane Hotel - UPDATED 2017 Reviews & Price Comparison (New York City) - TripAdvisor
thread.title: Great Location
thread.title_full: Great Location - Review of Park Lane Hotel, New York City, NY - TripAdvisor

author: stevo27
title: Great Location
text:
We visited New York for a friend's son's wedding. The family party booked this hotel so we joined them.
I think it's a tad expensive for what it provides but hey, that's New York all over.
As others have said the 'facilities fee' is $35 and compulsory, though we were lucky that the wedding party did negotiate a discount.
If you can afford the substantial premium for a park view room do go for it. The views of the park (especially after Storm Stella!) are spectacular.
Rooms are big and cleanish, but mostly very tired and in need of refurbs. Even the 44th floor suite we saw had the same standard of decoration. We first got a city view room on floor 9 which had a view of a wall and was next to noisy air con units. They moved us without fuss to floor 22 still city facing, but a better view and quieter.
The 5:00-7:00 'free' buffet was ok, there was tap beer, wines, water and soft drinks. Average food and some fruit. Nowhere near $35 per night though. Wifi worked ok and yes, international calls really are included.
The point of the hotel is the location. All the main subway lines are within a few minutes walk, and of course Central Park is across the street.
We didn't pay ($70!) for breakfast but there's an ok restaurant next door and a great food hall 50 metres away so that's an easy choice.
Staff were perfunctory rather than pleasant, but everything we asked for they did or we got so no complaints.
We'd consider staying there again but would look around for alternatives.
